Level1.question: In which section of the booklet can health care providers and researchers find further information about PCOS?

options: The New England Journal of Medicine
The British Journal of Diabetes & Vascular Disease
The Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism
Level1.correctAnswer: The British Journal of Diabetes & Vascular Disease

Level1.question: What is PCOS primarily defined by?

Level1.correctAnswer: European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology (ESHRE)

What is the main marker for diagnosing PCOS in adolescents?

options: Limiting inflammatory foods like dairy products and foods high in glycemic load
Level1.correctAnswer: Limiting inflammatory foods like dairy products and foods high in glycemic load

Level1.question: When do endocrine-disrupting chemicals pose the greatest risk for female reproductive health issues, including PCOS?

Level1.correctAnswer: During prenatal and early postnatal development

Eating a high-fiber, low-sugar diet with lots of vegetables, whole grains, and fruits
Level1.correctAnswer: Eating a high-fiber, low-sugar diet with lots of vegetables, whole grains, and fruits

options: PCOS Challenge: The National Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Association
American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
Level1.correctAnswer: PCOS Challenge: The National Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Association

Level1.question: What is one of the serious effects that women with PCOS are at higher risk for, as mentioned in the content?
options: Mental health disorders such as anxiety and depression
Level1.correctAnswer: Mental health disorders such as anxiety and depression

Level1.question: What is the term for the absence of a woman's monthly menstrual period?
Which hormone promotes the development and maintenance of male sex characteristics?
What does dyslipidemia refer to?
options: Problems with the heart and blood vessels
High levels of lipids in the blood
A closed, saclike pocket of tissue
Level1.correctAnswer: High levels of lipids in the blood

Level2.question: The presence of excessive _________ on various parts of the body is a common symptom of PCOS.
PCOS is often associated with an increased risk of _________.
Women with PCOS may have a higher incidence of _________ due to insulin resistance.
A common treatment for managing PCOS symptoms includes lifestyle changes such as improved diet and _________.
_________ metabolic abnormalities caused by PCOS that increase the risk of type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease.
options: Increased abdominal fat and insulin resistance
High muscle mass and decreased cholesterol
Low blood pressure and high protein intake
Increased calcium absorption and decreased glucose levels
Level2.correctAnswer: Increased abdominal fat and insulin resistance

Level2.question: __________ recommended by the CDC to manage PCOS symptoms?
options: 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week
Level2.correctAnswer: 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week

Level1.question: Which medical journal is mentioned in the content as a reference for screening for diabetes and cardiometabolic disease in women with PCOS?
options: The New England Journal of Medicine
The British Journal of Diabetes & Vascular Disease
The Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism
Level1.correctAnswer: The British Journal of Diabetes & Vascular Disease

Level2.question: Women with PCOS may have a higher incidence of _________ due to insulin resistance.

options: Increased abdominal fat and insulin resistance
High muscle mass and decreased cholesterol
Low blood pressure and high protein intake
Increased calcium absorption and decreased glucose levels
Level2.correctAnswer: Increased abdominal fat and insulin resistance
